summary: Sara-Lot van Uum is an academically trained and practice oriented researcher, project manager and curator, focused on building bridges between art, science, food and socially engaged practices. Manages and organises projects across various organisations and artistic platforms. Strong interests are: collaboration, experimentation and multidisciplinary research and practices.

'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Mediamatic', 'description': 'Responsible for the day-to-day operations of the 100% plant-based restaurant at the art centre Mediamatic in Amsterdam and coordinating restaurant activities during events such as weddings, (artistic) dinners and special programming. 

Mediamatic is an art centre dedicated to new developments in the arts since 1983, and organizes lectures, workshops and art projects, focusing on nature, biotechnology and art+science in a strong international network. Mediamatic is always looking for new developments in society and is interested in how art, design and science merge and how experimentation with new (living) materials can be used. At the restaurant and through special programming Mediamatic challenges the senses and tackles perceptions regarding food, waste and unconventional materials such as piss, bacteria and fungi. The processes involved are all based on sustainable principles, as Mediamatic wants to contribute to a circular economy.', 'title': 'Restaurant Manager | Mediamatic ETEN', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 18695084, 'name': 'ARIAS Amsterdam', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEHintup-GtNw/company-logo_400_400/0/1529839360504?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=XACZjSdvpB4miHTSmr9-CfvS5Sm02ULtqJe_wfZcsCw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ariasamsterdam/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'ARIAS Amsterdam', 'description': 'ARIAS is a platform for collaborative research through scientific and artistic practices. Its foundational drive is to nurture a diverse and sustainable research ecology among the institutions and organisations of education and knowledge in Amsterdam. The platform forwards research on the intersection of the sciences, arts, and other practice-based disciplines. ARIAS stimulates transdisciplinary collaborations and experimentation with innovative methodologies, and co-develops the supportive structures needed for such hybrid forms of research that make alternative perspectives on today’s complex issues possible.

I am currently helping the ARIAS team as a programme assistent (internship) with a specific focus on the thematic line of "Care Ecologies". See also: https://arias.amsterdam/.', 'title': 'Programme Assistant | ARIAS Platform for Research through the Arts and Sciences', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Tyge & Sessil', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'company': 'Tyge & Sessil', 'description': "Tyge & Sessil is Niklas Ekstedt's vincafé with a specific focus on natural wine and is located around the corner from Stureplan in Stockholm. Tyge & Sessil's wine list is based on wine from small producers, who work as close to nature as possible, preferably from underrepresented areas around the world and made from unknown grapes.", 'title': 'Natural Wine Sommelier | Vincafé Tyge & Sessil ', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 166164, 'name': 'Stockholm University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEDDr4dLuJjYw/company-logo_400_400/0/1651005531652?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=do5K0IwI3H0Kc4CJE7R39dKVE0Do7g4u1F5vcnow4Jc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/stockholm-university/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Stockholm University', 'description': 'At Accelerator, art encounters research in an interdisciplinary dialogue on contemporary issues and challenges. The aim is to foster the exchange of knowledge and reflections on how art and science address current societal issues based on their respective disciplines. In the programme Art + Research, Accelerator’s artistic team collaborates with researchers whose work relates to current issues and themes explored in the exhibitions. The collaboration results in a public programme comprising lectures, discussions and seminars in which artists, researchers, students and the general public are invited to participate. The purpose of Art + Research is to stimulate innovative thinking through an exchange of knowledge, experiences and perspectives. An important cornerstone of Accelerator’s activities is the connection to contemporary issues and societal challenges. The Art + Research programme provides a platform for interdisciplinary dialogue and enables the exploration of new types of knowledge and ways of discussing research through art.

The internship included assisting Accelerator’s Project Leader Bronwyn Bailey-Charteris with the Researcher Collaborations over a period starting in November 2019 – May 2020.', 'title': 'Assistant | Accelerator Researcher Collaborations ', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': 71382825, 'name': 'ArkDes (Statens centrum för arkitektur och design)', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQHvpQRD-9BTQQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1638868256487?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=zmqAQlyOvItRfHlDntSBBT-DkA48ANIDKobZt9N5JWM', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/arkdes/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'ArkDes', 'description': 'During the summer of 2020, the artist Linda Tegg shifted the ground at the entrance to ArkDes from an asphalt car park to a biodiverse meadowland. The plants in the installation are representative of those found in Sweden's infields, which are enclosed meadows often adjacent to a farm. ArkDes has a special mission from the government to be a place of meeting and debate about the future of Swedish architecture and design, especially with regard to Sweden's national architecture and design policy. "Infield" adds to this debate by asking questions of what the public spaces of the future might look like, if we work with nature instead of against it, making space for non-human species and sharing the city with them. The installation has come together during the Covid-19 pandemic.  I have had the great fortune to work as a member of the production team at ArkDes in collaboration with Tiits Trädgård.', 'title': 'Production Team Member ArkDes | Linda Tegg's "Infield" installation', 'employment_type': 'Seasonal'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Netherlands Institute for Cultural Analysis', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Netherlands Institute for Cultural Analysis', 'description': "The Artistic Research Research group focuses on artistic research as a new approach to tackling research questions and it aims at promoting the exchange of ideas between artists and scholars from a wide range of fields and disciplines. As an assistant I was responsible for the organisation of a series of seminars (2018-2019) where the members of the group presented their research and receive feedback from their peers. One or two artistic researchers who have recently completed their PhD's were invited to share their process with the participants of the seminars. The presentations could take the form the presenters find most suitable and productive: a film screening, a performance or a standard keynote.", 'title': 'Assistant | ASCA Research Group on Artistic Research (ARRG)', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': 1423204, 'name': 'Stichting Simulacrum', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEjXhayjXTAQA/company-logo_400_400/0/1624622575132?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=AHKm6Nylbhwt4L14tJEQ4b-gJMFwnxtpKZ6BraSDpaY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/simulacrum-magazine/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Simulacrum Magazine', 'description': 'Simulacrum is een tijdschrift voor kunst en cultuur, dat dient als laagdrempelig en kwalitatief publicatieplatform voor studenten en deskundigen uit het veld. Per jaar verschijnen vier nummers, iedere keer onder de noemer van een bepaald thema. De onderwerpen worden altijd benaderd vanuit verschillende disciplines binnen de kunst- en cultuurwetenschappen, en zowel in historisch als hedendaags perspectief geplaatst.', 'title': 'Editor and event manager | SIMULACRUM: arts & culture magazine', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 1802378, 'name': 'Academie van de Stad', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHTOOpyrnwMfw/company-logo_400_400/0/1580977734953?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=KNYlvhsfnwVr2FqRfm52qHIKlDfPpcLqrPWXs8tsMnA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/academie-van-de-stad/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'Academie van de Stad', 'description': 'In the context of "Springlevend van der Pek", a project where students live in the area and set up and coordinate projects, I have contributed to the Greenteam project to promote "greening" the area. The Greenteam's Green Gardens project is a collaboration with residents and professionals in Van der Pek area in the North of Amsterdam. The Greenteam maintains backyard gardens of people who are unable to do this themselves. The students receive help from local residents, neighborhood kids and also from volunteers via Stichting Syrische Vrijwilligers Nederland (SYVNL).

The Greenteam also organizes "Tuintjeleen" where residents who do not have a garden themselves, but do want to garden, can adopt the garden of a neighbor and make joint agreements about the use and maintenance of the garden. Residents who just want to help their neighbors from time to time can also become a Garden Buddy: someone who occasionally helps in the garden. In addition, residents can also adopt a tree trunk in the area to maintain.', 'title': 'Student Coordinator van der Pek Greenteam | Academie van de Stad', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}]
